intro: Spermacoce spinosa, commonly known as the spiked morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to black as they mature. Spermacoce spinosa is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
